ygData.subject: Re: Re:Re: Guise of the Deceiver (Longish)
ygData.msgSnippet: Off course I post about what makes me happy - I see you have no problems developing your own list. To each his own - my point is, you hit level 50 - then what?
ygData.messageBody:
Off course I post about what makes me happy - I see you have no problems
developing your own list.

To each his own - my point is, you hit level 50 - then what? I'm not trying
to take away anything from your experience - perhaps broaden your horizons
just a bit.

I guess in my apparently inept way - I'm advising you to stop and smell the
flowers. Value those around you a bit more - appreciate the little things
that can make for a fuller experience.

That is the one fatal flaw EQ made that will probably forever keep it from
being a true virtual world - the level system denotes an end.



At 11:43 AM 12/14/99 -0500, you wrote:
>From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
>
>> You must have missed my post where I said I don't EVER care if I level
>> again past 23. I'll probably never see SolB - nor do I particularly care
to.
>
> You are in the minority I can assure you. If you enjoy fishing,
> baking, brewing, telling stories around the campfire, then that's
> your POV. I'm not gonna waste 10bux a month to essentially IRC
> with pretty graphics. I want to advance, I want to have some
> goodies, and I want to show those goodies off to people because
> I spent the time to earn them. I want to be a powerful element
> to plane attacks and dragon raids. I was in a group last night
> that dinged two L49 people to L50. L50 people are turning out like
> mad. I'm feeling the crunch too. Nagafen's Lair and Lower Guk
> are becoming so crowded that it's rare to even see monsters, let
> alone fight them. I know for a fact that there are at least 100
> L50 people on Innoruuk and we add one more avg each day it seems.
> When 1/16th of your server's population is 50, and probably another
> 3/16th is L35+ that spells trouble and crowding. Trying to squeeze
> a quarter of the server into two zones really hurts.
>
> The whole premise behind your posts is what makes you, yourself
> happy. I honestly find your selfish ripostes to comments about
> the whole community very weak and one sided. What I didn't miss
> is your careless attitude, however. Whatever makes silky's 10
> dollars count isn't why I play the game, btw. And while I respect
> anyone's opinion including yours, you are very much lacking the
> delivery of your opinion in an organized, non-offensive manner.
> It's like you've got something to prove about yourself, and at
> the same time you trying to disprove any statement that comes
> down the pipe. It's a rare day to see you post complimenting
> anything. I suppose I can continue wishing. 8)
>
> Harmonic.
>
>>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
